query: Khomyuk reveals to them a report of a similar but more benign accident at the Leningrad Nuclear Power Plant in 1975, which was censored by the KGB?
What does the Plot section say about Episode 4?
While the "Liquidators" must kill all the dogs and cats in the exclusion zone, Legasov wonders how to remove the highly irradiated graphite from the reactor's roof?
Khomyuk visits the archives in Moscow and confronts Dyatlov with the accusation that the government is not interested in the truth?
What does the Summary section say about Episode 4?
The liquidators' commander, General Nikolai Tarakanov, has lunar landers placed on the roof of the power plant to prepare the roof for the sarcophagus and to clear the radioactive debris?
